item.title: React Router 7 middleware now supported
item.description: 🚀 Exciting news for developers! React Router 7 has launched its middleware feature, now stable since version 7.9.0. 👨‍💻 Middleware is fully supported on Netlify. To get started, ensure you’re on version 7.9.0 or later and upgrade to version 2 of the Netlify plugin. 📚 For more information, check the React Router middleware docs and explore the updated templates. #ReactRouter #WebDevelopment #Netlify #Middleware #JavaScript

item.title: Skew protection now available
item.description: 🚀 Exciting news for developers! Netlify has launched skew protection for all plans, starting with Astro 5.15.0+ and Next.js. This new feature addresses version mismatch errors during site deployments. It ensures users remain on the same version throughout their session, preventing issues like broken assets, 404 errors, and degraded experiences. To implement this, check your framework’s compatibility with our Frameworks API. For more details, explore our blog post on skew protection. #Netlify…

item.title: Next.js 16 is ready to deploy on Netlify
item.description: 🚀 Exciting news for developers! Next.js 16 has launched, and it’s ready to deploy on Netlify. Key features include: - Turbopack: Up to 10× faster Fast Refresh and 2-5× faster builds. - React Compiler: Automatic memoization for smoother re-renders. - Improved caching APIs: New options for revalidating tags and refreshing cached data. Upgrading from v15? No changes to Netlify configuration are needed! 🔗 Explore the demo and read the full release for more details. #Nextjs16 #Netlify…

item.title: Enforce Git-based workflows for production deploys
item.description: 🚀 New feature alert! You can now enforce Git-based workflows for all production deploys in your project settings. This prevents accidental production publishes via the Netlify CLI, MCP server, or API. Additionally, it stops promoting Deploy Previews or branch deploys to production through the Netlify UI. Ensure that everyone, including AI agents, adheres to your Git workflow before code reaches production. For more details, check out the Git workflow docs. #GitWorkflow #Netlify…

item.title: Claude Haiku 4.5 is now available in the AI Gateway
item.description: 🚀 Claude Haiku 4.5 is now live on Netlify’s AI Gateway! No extra setup is needed to access the native Anthropic SDK. This allows users to avoid managing API keys or external accounts. Check out how to implement it in a Netlify Function with example code for easy integration. Supported across Edge, Background, and Scheduled Functions, it offers features like Rate-Limiting and advanced caching. Learn more in the AI Gateway docs! 📄💻 #AI #Netlify #ClaudeHaiku #Anthropic #TechUpdate

item.title: GPT 5 Pro now available in the AI Gateway
item.description: 🚀 GPT-5 Pro is now accessible via Netlify’s AI Gateway with no extra setup needed! You can directly use the OpenAI SDK, simplifying the process without managing API keys or accounts. It supports Edge, Background, and Scheduled Functions, offering features like Rate-Limiting and advanced caching. Explore more in the AI Gateway documentation! 📚💻 #GPT5Pro #Netlify #AIGateway #OpenAI #TechUpdates

item.description: 📣 Important updates on credit-based Personal and Pro plans! As a bonus, Pro subscribers who signed up before October 1st will receive 2,000 extra credits this month! Explore plans and costs with our pricing calculator….

item.title: Legacy plans can now update to credit-based plans
item.description: 🚀 Legacy pricing accounts can keep their current plans without any changes. However, there’s an option to switch to new credit-based plans if desired. 🔍 Explore updated pricing and learn about the credit system. Use the pricing calculator to estimate costs effectively. 💬 For further questions, refer to the legacy plans FAQ or contact support. #PricingUpdate #CreditBasedPlans #CustomerSupport

item.title: Netlify pricing update: Introducing credit-based plans
item.description: 🚀 Netlify has introduced credit-based plans for new accounts, simplifying pricing for better transparency. Current users can remain on their legacy plans, with options to switch soon. The new system uses a single credit balance instead of multiple metrics. 🔍 Three plans are now available: - Free: 300 credits, $0 - Personal: 1,000 credits, $9/month - Pro: 5,000 credits, $20/member/month Additional credits can be purchased as needed, and costs remain predictable. item.description: 🚨 Security Alert for Next.js Users 🚨 Recent vulnerabilities have been disclosed affecting Next.js applications, including issues related to arbitrary file downloads and cache poisoning.
